name: Is He, or Isn't He? Online Trivia | Miscellaneous Animal Trivia | 15 Questions

questions.explanation:
No.

	A starfish is an echinoderm, a relative of sea urchins and sea cucumbers.

questions.text: Is a miner's cat a cat?
questions.explanation:
No.

	"Miner's cat" is another name for the cacomistle, a member of the raccoon family that looks like a raccoon on a diet. It hung around miner's cabins and ate mice, hence the name.

questions.text: Is a Przewalski's horse a horse?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	It's a highly endangered species that probably gave rise to the tough and intelligent mounts of the Mongols.

questions.text: Is a raccoon dog a dog?
questions.explanation:
No.

	This Asian canid actually does resemble a big raccoon, minus the striped tail. In Japanese folklore, it's called "tanuki" and is a symbol of virility.

questions.text: Is a Bombay duck a duck?
questions.explanation:
No.

	It's a long thin ocean fish, most well known as a seasoning in curries!

questions.text: Is a Barbary ape an ape?
questions.explanation:
No.

	The only primate found in Europe, it's actually a monkey; one of the macaque family. Apes do not have tails, monkeys do.

No.

	It's actually a member of the blackbird family. True larks are European.

questions.text: Is a velvet ant an ant?
questions.explanation:
No.

	It is a type of fuzzy wingless wasp.

questions.text: Is a prairie chicken a chicken?
questions.explanation:
No.

	It's a member of the grouse family, known for the flamboyant displays of the males.

questions.text: Is a sun bear a bear?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	This Asian bear is the smallest member of the bear family.

questions.text: Is a nurse shark a shark?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	These sharks are often large but usually harmless. It may have gotten its name from the sucking noises it makes while feeding, like a nursing baby.

questions.text: Is a mourning dove a dove?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	One of the commonest birds in North America, this dove can nest several times a year in warm climates.

questions.text: Is a button quail a quail?
questions.explanation:
No.

	This tiny bird has its own family, the Turnicidae. Unlike true quail, they have only 3 toes- they lack a hind toe.

Yes.

	True flies have only 2 wings, not 4 like most insects.

questions.text: Is a glass snake a snake?
questions.explanation:
No.

	Glass snakes are legless lizards. Unlike true snakes, they have eyelids.
